sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: After an unimaginably harrowing journey to reach land, survivors arrive at a migrant facility in Malakaza, Greece, after Wednesday's devastating boat disaster.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The vessel went down off the coast of Pelos.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Survivors suggest that there could have been as many as 750 people on board.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: For now, there are 95 migrants at this reception and identification centre.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It can host a maximum of 1,500 people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: This as nine Egyptian men were charged as suspected people traffickers in front of the public prosecutor on Thursday night.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: They stand accused of orchestrating the illegal entry of these migrants.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Prosecutors claim they are responsible for the shipwreck and endangering lives.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The UN says the tragedy highlights the need for EU states to better manage migration channels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: What happened on Wednesday underscores the need to investigate people smugglers and human traffickers and ensure they are brought to justice.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The search operation continued overnight but no more survivors were found. So far 78 people are confirmed dead but millions more are still missing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The delegation of four African leaders and three senior officials who are visiting Ukraine

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: say they want to seek an end to the war. African governments however are divided as to who to blame.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Last year in a UN vote only 28 out of 54 of them were prepared to condemn Russia's invasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Their visit on Friday was interrupted by air raid sirens sounding as Russia fired more missiles at Ukraine's capital.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Ukraine's foreign minister said the attack sent a message that Russia wants war, not peace.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: A delegation also visited Bucha, where hundreds of Ukrainians were massacred by Russian forces at the start of the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The leaders of South Africa, Senegal and Uganda haven't condemned Russia, whilst another three, who are senior leaders from Egypt, Zambia and Comoros, have.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But all seven of them do agree that fertilizer and food supplies from Ukraine to Africa that have been affected by the war should be increased.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: President Vladimir Putin in St. Petersburg on Saturday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Russia's main international economic forum in St. Petersburg used to be designed to attract foreign capital to Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But Western sanctions have led many international investors to stay away. And Western journalists used to attend the forum, but now they're almost all banned.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: President Putin on Friday used the gathering to announce the first batch of nuclear weapons has been deployed delivered to Belarus. But only the first ones. This is the first part.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But by the end of summer, by the end of the year, we will complete this work completely.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: President Putin also boasted of having more nuclear weapons than NATO and rejected the idea of rejoining negotiations on reducing both of their nuclear arsenals.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Analysts fear that could trigger a new nuclear arms race and increase the risk of a nuclear conflict.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Kosovo's prime minister says tensions remain high

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: after what he described as Serbia's kidnapping of three police officers inside Kosovo on Wednesday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But Serbia insists it legally arrested the officers inside Serbia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: In a statement on Friday, the NATO peacekeeping mission said it remains unclear where the officers were at the time of their detention.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: After sentencing 30 days with additional detention in remand for our three abducted policemen in the northern municipality of Lepusavis, inside the territory of Kosovo, by special military units of Serbian police and military.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The high-level officials gathered on this PESPA forum called the leaders of Serbia and Kosovo to return to negotiating table as soon as possible and find a solution for this problem that burdens the entire region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In Struga, North Macedonia, for UN News, Borjan Jovanovski.
